problem_statement: Write a program that takes three positive integers as input: n, m, and a. These integers represent the dimensions of a rectangular Theatre Square and the size of each square granite flagstone (a x a). The program should calculate and output the minimum number of flagstones needed to pave the entire Theatre Square, considering that the flagstones cannot be broken and their sides should be parallel to the sides of the Square.
problem_input: Input The input contains three positive integer numbers in the first line:  n,   m  and  a  ( 1 ≤   n ,  m ,  a  ≤ 10 9 ).
problem_output: Output Write the needed number of flagstones.
problem_notes: No notes available for this problem.

problem_statement:
Design a program to determine the winner of a card game called "Berlogging". 

The program will be given an integer n (1 <= n <= 1000), which represents the number of rounds played in the game. Following that, it will receive n lines, each containing the information about a round in the format "name score". The name of each player is a string consisting of lowercase Latin letters, with a length between 1 and 32 characters. The score of each round is an integer between -1000 and 1000, inclusive.

The objective of the program is to identify the winner(s) of the game according to the following rules:
1. If there is only one player with the maximum number of points at the end
problem_input: Input The first line contains an integer number  n  ( 1  ≤   n   ≤  1000 ),  n  is the number of rounds played. Then follow  n  lines, containing the information about the rounds in “ name score “ format in chronological order, where  name  is a string of lower-case Latin letters with the length from 1 to 32, and  score  is an integer number between -1000 and 1000, inclusive.
problem_output: Output Print the name of the winner.
problem_notes: No notes available for this problem.
